name: Thieves Guild
description: Once Skyrim's most influential criminal organization, the Thieves Guild now survives as a shadow of its former self. Centered in Riften's ratway tunnels, the guild is struggling â€“ jobs are scarce, coin is low, and its luck is said to be cursed. Members still stick together under the leadership of Mercer Frey, pulling pickpocketing, burglary, and smuggling jobs where they can. The guild operates in secrecy, dealing in stolen goods and information. With the right leadership and a bit of luck, they hope to restore their prominence across Skyrim's cities.
goals: Rebuild the Guild's wealth and influence in each major city
Uncover and exploit lucrative opportunities (heists, cons, smuggling routes)
Protect guild members and their secrets from outsiders
Appease Nocturnal and lift the curse on the Guild's luck

clock.name: Guild Restoration
clock.description: Progress toward restoring the Thieves Guild to its former glory across Skyrim

relationships.Black-Briar Family: Allied - Maven Black-Briar offers political protection and jobs, for a cut of the profits
relationships.Riften Guard: Hostile - the city guard would love to jail every guild member if they could find proof
relationships.Dark Brotherhood: Neutral - an understanding exists to respect each other's turf; they occasionally trade information
relationships.City Merchants: Mixed - some secretly cooperate for kickbacks, others fear and despise the Guild's thefts

notable_members: Galathil (Guild member, face changer - if applicable)
notes: The Thieves Guild uses a reputation system: as the player completes jobs and quests for the guild, their standing (and the guild's prosperity) improves. Advancement through ranks (Initiate to Guild Master) unlocks new benefits (fences pay more, access to Guild resources, etc.). Nocturnal's favor is tied to the Guild's success; the ultimate goal is to return the Skeleton Key to its shrine to lift the curse affecting their luck.
